thread.title_full: Naukri shares gain 2% after Q2 business update shows 12% growth in billings - The Economic Times

title: Naukri shares gain 2% after Q2 business update shows 12% growth in billings - The Economic Times
text: Shares of Info Edge (India), which operates the popular job portal Naukri.com, rose 2.13% to their day’s high of Rs 1,396.85 on the BSE on Thursday, October 9, after the company reported a 12.1% year-on-year (YoY) rise in standalone billings for the quarter ended September 30, 2025.According to the company’s Q2FY26 business update, total billings for the quarter stood at Rs 729 crore, up from Rs 650.3 crore in the same period last year.For the six months ended September 30, 2025, billings rose to Rs 1,373.2 crore, compared with Rs 1,229.7 crore in the corresponding period of the previous fiscal.Segment-wise, Recruitment Solutions, the company’s flagship vertical under the Naukri.com brand, contributed Rs 545 crore in Q2FY26, up from Rs 492 crore in Q2FY25. For the half-year period, billings from this segment reached Rs 1,015.3 crore, versus Rs 923.4 crore a year ago.The company’s real estate platform, 99acres.com, reported billings of Rs 122.4 crore for the quarter, compared with Rs 107.4 crore in the year-ago quarter. For the six months ended September 2025, billings from this vertical came in at Rs 216.8 crore, up from Rs 188.4 crore in H1FY25.Meanwhile, the ‘Others’ segment contributed Rs 61.6 crore in Q2FY26, rising from Rs 50.9 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. For the first half of FY26, billings from this segment increased to Rs 141.1 crore from Rs 117.9 crore a year earlier.Info Edge said the numbers are unaudited and released ahead of the formal announcement of its financial results. The figures are subject to review and approval by the Audit Committee, Board of Directors, and Statutory Auditors.Also read: Tata Motors demerger effect: Shares slip 7% in 4 days. What investors need to know ahead of record date(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of The Economic Times)
